intro: Nonea pulla var. armeniaca, commonly known as Armenian mountain thyme, is a perennial herb native to the high elevations of the Caucasus region. It features aromatic, narrow leaves and small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in summer. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. It has been traditionally used in local medicine for its purported antiseptic and anti-inflammatory properties. Botanically, it belongs to the Lamiaceae family, sharing characteristics with other members of the mint family.
